author: Staff Reporter
text:
Adding to the efforts at creating awareness on the need to vote, booth-level awareness Group (BAGs) will be formed in the villages. These groups will consist of anganwadi workers, teachers, staff of the postal department and people’s representatives who are not affiliated to any political party.

District Collector R. Nanthagopal, who is also the district election officer, told returning officers and assistant returning officers to take steps to form these groups during a review meeting on Thursday.

Banners, posters removed

Meanwhile, as many as 2,265 wall paintings, 1,308 banners, 3,450 wall posters and 922 other form of advertisements were identified across the 13 constituencies of the district.

Out of the 7,965 cases booked, 5,162 advertisements have been removed.

The Collector directed the officers to take steps to remove the remaining 2,803 political advertisements immediately and record the details online, a press release said.

Poll staff enumeration

EPIC numbers of staff involved in polling duty such as zonal officers, deputy zonal officers, office staff, drivers, office assistants and videographers should be collected and sent to enable them to cast their votes through postal votes, the release added.
title: Booth-level awareness groups to be constituted in villages soon
